identificationModule.briefTitle: Effect of Music on Reading Comprehension in Patients With Aphasia
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Music on Reading Comprehension in Patients With Aphasia

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this investigation is to examine the evidence on emotion, language, and music, and propose a first step, in the form of a single-subject research design, to determine the most effective and efficient method for application to the rehabilitation of patients with aphasia. A single-subject adapted alternating treatment design will be used to compare two music conditions, using music with sung lyrics simultaneously with reading of the lyrics, and priming with music and sung lyrics followed by a reading of the lyrics, with a control condition using reading lyrics without music. Results are expected to provide evidence of independent versus shared processing of music and language at the phrase level applied to the behavior of human subjects with aphasia.

armGroups.label: Music and reading lyrics
armGroups.description: A single-subject adapted alternating treatment design will be used to compare two music conditions, using music with sung lyrics simultaneously with silent reading of the lyrics, and priming with music and sung lyrics followed by reading of the lyrics, with a control condition using reading materials without music.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Simultaneous music and reading lyrics

interventions.name: Simultaneous music and reading lyrics
interventions.description: listening to music with singing of the lyrics simultaneously with reading the written lyrics.

interventions.name: Priming with music
interventions.description: priming by listening to music and singing of the lyrics followed by reading the written lyrics.

interventions.name: Control
interventions.description: control condition using reading materials without music.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percent correct responses per day on phrase completion task.
primaryOutcomes.description: Differential response to the interventions (counted as the percent correct responses per day).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 1 year.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of sessions required to achieve mastery.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 1 year.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: International Classification of Functioning, Disability, and Health (ICF) body Functions/Structures, Activities, and Participation.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pretest-posttest information on the ICF Body Functions/Structures, Activities, and Participation (Hurkmans et al., 2011).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 1 year.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Boston Diagnostic Aphasia Examination-Third Edition (BDAE-3) (Goodglass, Harold, & Barresi, Austin: PRO-Ed.).
secondaryOutcomes.description: BDAE-3 pretest-posttest reading scores on subtests: Word Identification/Word-Picture Match and Lexical Decision; Homophone Matching; Derivational and Grammatical Morphology/Matching to spoken sample; Oral Reading/Basic oral word reading; Oral Reading of Sentences with Comprehension; and Reading Comprehension-Sentences and Paragraphs. Pretest will be completed prior to baseline and initiating intervention, and posttest with be completed immediately following completion of intervention to assess generalization to non-trained stimuli.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 1 year.
